name: Adapter Endpoint
description: Sends a message to an adapter

list.name: Bindings
list.description: Bindings allow environment variables to be used to determine the values of properties at runtime.

list.name: Name
list.description: A user defined name for this pipeline step

list.name: Disable
list.description: If this Process step is disabled for Process step execution

list.description: Old BreakPointState

list.name: RequireThreadSafety
list.description: Flag to determine if the custom process step instance will be recreated with each execution. There is a performance hit with this.

list.name: Adapter Endpoint
list.description: Select an existing adapter endpoint (connector).

list.name: Timeout
list.description: The time that the process will wait for a reply message to be returned from the adapter endpoint. For multicast messages, this is ignored.

list.name: Adapter
list.description: The name of the adapter hosted by the adapter endpoint.

list.name: Category
list.description: Category of the selected adapter. Used for Neuron ESB Explorer filtering.

list.name: Mode
list.description: The mode that the adapter is configured to run in.

list.name: Party Id
list.description: The party that the adapter is configured to send messages to the adapter as.

list.name: Policy
list.description: The policy that will be applied to handle retries if sending the message to the adapter fails.

list.name: Run As
list.description: The user account to impersonate when sending the message to the adapter.

list.name: Maximum Instances
list.description: The maximum number of adapter instances that will be created to serve all instances of the process.

list.name: Pool Timeout
list.description: If an adapter is not available before the timeout expires, then a timeout exception will be raised.

name: MSMQ
description: Send or receive a message to MSMQ

list.name: Bindings
list.description: Bindings allow environment variables to be used to determine the values of properties at runtime.

list.name: Queue Path
list.description: The path of the MSMQ queue to send to or receive from. Can be dynamically set using msmq.QueuePath Esb Message property. i.e. '.\Private$\QueueName'

list.name: Transactional
list.description: To participate in transaction, you must be using transactional message queues. If the queue is not on localhost, then MSDTC must be running. Remote transactional reads are only supported with Msmq 4.0 and higher.

list.name: Clear Connection Cache
list.description: The format names stored in the cache are removed and handles opened and stored in the cache are closed.

list.name: Use ActiveXMessageFormatter
list.description: Formatter compatible with Message Queuing COM components

list.name: Extended Properties
list.description: Retrieves MSMQ Message properties when reading a message from a queue and applies them as custom Neuron ESB Message Propertiees. Dynamically sets MSMQ Message properties from the Neuron ESB Messsage when sending to a queue.

list.name: Operation
list.description: Determines whether to Send, Receive or Peek a message from the MSMQ Queue.

list.name: Correlate
list.description: Receives message that correlates with a previously sent message. The MSMQ Correlation Id property must be set using the Set Property Process Step e.g. 'msmq.CorrelationId'

list.name: Correlation Id
list.description: The MSMQ Correlation Id to use for correlated sends and receives. This property can also be set dynamically using the Set Property Process Step e.g. 'msmq.CorrelationId'

list.name: Name
list.description: A user defined name for this pipeline step

list.name: Disable
list.description: If this Process step is disabled for Process step execution

list.name: BreakPoint
list.description: Add/Remove an BreakPoint from the Process Step

list.name: OldBreakPointState
list.description: Old BreakPointState

list.name: RequireThreadSafety
list.description: Flag to determine if the custom process step instance will be recreated with each execution. There is a performance hit with this.

list.name: Timeout
list.description: The receive timeout for retreiving message from queue.

list.name: AppSpecific
list.description: AppSpecific property assigned to MSMQ Message. Can be dynamically set using msmq.AppSpecific Neuron Esb Message property.

list.name: Label
list.description: Label applied to MSMQ Message. Can be dynamically set using msmq.Label Neuron Esb Message property.

list.name: Priority
list.description: Priority level assigned to MSMQ Message. Can be dynamically set using msmq.Priority Neuron Esb Message property.

list.name: Recoverable
list.description: By default, MSMQ stores some messages in memory for increased performance, and a message may be sent and received from a queue without ever having been written to disk. One can control this behavior, forcing MSMQ to store a message to disk, by specifying that a message should be recoverable. Can be dynamically set using msmq.Recoverable Neuron Esb Message property.

list.name: Bindings
list.description: Bindings allow environment variables to be used to determine the values of properties at runtime.

list.name: Name
list.description: A user defined name for this pipeline step

list.name: Disable
list.description: If this Process step is disabled for Process step execution

list.name: BreakPoint
list.description: Add/Remove an BreakPoint from the Process Step

list.name: OldBreakPointState
list.description: Old BreakPointState

list.name: RequireThreadSafety
list.description: Flag to determine if the custom process step instance will be recreated with each execution. There is a performance hit with this.

list.name: Convert To
list.description: Determines if incoming message will be converted to Xml, JSON or Class

list.name: Exclude Xml Root
list.description: When converting to Json, this will exclude the root element from serializing.

list.name: Remove Xml Namespaces
list.description: When converting to Json, this will remove the namespaces from serializing.

list.name: Class Type
list.description: The fully qualified name of a .NET class to serialize/deserialize to. The assembly must be in the GAC or in the Neuron folder.

list.name: XML Root Name
list.description: Optional. Xml Root name to apply if converting JSON (without a root object) to XML. If a root already exists, this root name will be removed from final XML

list.name: DateTime Format
list.description: Optional. Used if converting from a .NET Class to JSON, or from JSON to a .NET Class. Default value is the internet datetime format i.e. 'yyyy-MM-ddTHH:mm:ss.fffffffzzz'.

list.name: Null Value Handling
list.description: Optional. Used if converting from a .NET Class or XML to JSON. If None, IsEmpty fields e.g. xsi:nil='true', will be displayed as xsi:nil='true'. If set to Null, the element will display a null value. If set to EmptyString, the element will display an empty string as a value.

list.name: Include Xml Declaration
list.description: Optional. When converting to XML, this will determine if the XML Declaration is written. By default this is true.

list.name: Include Object Type Names
list.description: Optional. Include the .NET type name when serializing into a JSON object structure. By default this is false.

list.name: Transactional
list.description: To participate in an existing transaction, you must be using transactional Topics. None will result in no transaction used. Requires will enlist in the existing transaction. RequiresNew will create a new transaction.

list.description: The number of seconds required for the Transaction to timeout. if less than 1, the timeout will default to 30 seconds

list.description: Requires that all parameter elements include the type attribute with the appropriate Odbc Data type value.

list.description: Enables dynamic sql to be passed to adapter. If set to false, then only stored procedures are allowed.

list.name: Neuron Semantic

list.name: Use Parameter Mapper
list.description: When set to true, you will map data from the ESB Message body, message headers or message properties, or provide a default value.  When set to false the ESB Message body must be in the XML as described in the documentation.

list.description: Number of rows to return from odbc statement resultset. If -1 or 0, then all rows returned.

list.name: Throw Error on Exception
list.description: If true, an error will be thrown back to the calling Business Process. If false, the error information will be returned as the body of the response message.
